intro: Costularia leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited costularia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Nigeria and Uganda. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its fruits are distinctive, being white and spherical, which contribute to its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
